Authors: Rafael Felipe de Almeida, Cassio van den Berg
Title:
Molecular phylogeny and character mapping support generic
adjustments in the Tetrapteroid clade (Malpighiaceae)
Abstract:
Malpighiaceae has gone through unprecedented changes in
its traditional classification due to molecular phylogenetic studies in
the past two decades. However, some generic adjustments are still needed
to render some genera monophyletic. In this study, we propose a new
genus of Malpighiaceae to accommodate the species of Tetrapterys pro
parte, a well-supported lineage recovered by us and by the last
phylogenetic studies for the family. Additionally, we propose the
synonymy of Aenigmatanthera under Niedenzuella to finally render the
latter monophyletic. Morphological characters related to inflorescence
architecture, bract and bracteole size, presence of glands on the bracts
and bracteoles, style size and thickness, and ratio length among
superior and anterior lateral wings of mericarps were key in
circumscribing these lineages.
